text: Tyler Adwen Tumminia is an American sports executive. She is currently the interim commisioner of the National Women's Hockey League (NWHL). Prior to her involvement with the NWHL she was a baseball executive. Tumminia's father, John Tumminia, worked as a scout for the Chicago White Sox. He named her after Ty Cobb. Tumminia graduated from Mount Saint Mary College. She joined the Goldklang Group, which operates the Charleston RiverDogs, Fort Myers Miracle, Hudson Valley Renegades, St. Paul Saints, and Pittsfield Suns, in 2004. She was promoted to senior vice president in February 2011. In October 2011, she graduated from Major League Baseball's Scout Development Program. Tumminia married Ben Cherington on April 6, 2012, at Brooklyn Borough Hall. The couple has two daughters. In early 2020, Tumminia went from baseball to hockey and was named chair of the Toronto Six of the National Women's Hockey League. On October 12, 2020, Tumminia was named interim commissioner of the National Women's Hockey League, succeeding league founder Dani Rylan, during a league governance restructuring. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Living people Category:Mount Saint Mary College alumni Category:Minor league baseball executives Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:National Women's Hockey League (2015–) commissioners Category:Women in American professional sports management Category:Women ice hockey executives Category:American sports executives and administrators
title: Tyler Tumminia
